code:
def is_prime?(n)
  return false if n < 2
  return true if n == 2
  return false if n.even?
  limit = Math.sqrt(n).to_i
  (3..limit).step(2) do |i|
    return false if n % i == 0
  end
  true
end
final_answer(answer: "def is_prime?(n)\n  return false if n < 2\n  return true if n == 2\n  return false if n.even?\n  limit = Math.sqrt(n).to_i\n  (3..limit).step(2) { |i| return false if n % i == 0 }\n  true\nend")

Thought: Provide a concise Ruby method that determines whether a given integer is prime.
```ruby
def is_prime?(n)
  return false if n < 2
  return true if n == 2
  return false if n.even?
  limit = Math.sqrt(n).to_i
  (3..limit).step(2) do |i|
    return false if n % i == 0
  end
  true
end
```
